But Error, wounded, writhes in pain,
And dies among his worshippers.

name: Cloths
description:
Reclaim // fall 2013

"But I, being poor, have only my dreams"

HAD I the heavens’ embroidered cloths,
Enwrought with golden and silver light,
The blue and the dim and the dark cloths
Of night and light and the half light,
I would spread the cloths under your feet:
But I, being poor, have only my dreams;
I have spread my dreams under your feet;
Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.


-W. B. Yeats: Aedh wishes for the Cloths of Heaven

name: Connection
description:
Connection In late summer, the stars Altair and Vega are high in the night sky, and the Chinese tell the following love story: A young cowherd, Niulang, came across a beautiful girl, Zhinü, the seventh daughter of the Goddess. Zhinü soon fell in love with Niulang, and they got married and had two children. But the Goddess of heaven found out that Zhinü, a fairy girl, had married a mere mortal. The Goddess was furious and ordered Zhinü to return to heaven. On Earth, Niulang was very upset that his wife had disappeared. Suddenly, his ox began to talk, telling him that if he killed it and put on its hide, he would be able to go up to Heaven to find his wife. Crying bitterly, he killed the ox, put on the skin, and carried his two beloved children off to heaven to find Zhinü. The Goddess discovered this and was very angry. Taking out her hairpin, the Goddess scratched a wide river in the sky to separate the two lovers forever, thus forming the Milky Way between Altair (Niulang) and Vega (Zhinü). Zhinü must sit forever on one side of the river, while Niulang watches her from afar while taking care of their two children (his flanking stars β and γ). But once a year all the magpies in the world would take pity on them and fly up into heaven to form a bridge so the lovers may be together for a single night.

name: Haiti Benefit Tee (Blue)
description:
The 2010 Haiti earthquake was a catastrophic magnitude 7.0 earthquake. Its epicentre was near Léogâne, approximately 16 miles west of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti. The earthquake occurred on Tuesday, 12 January 2010, The United States Geological Survey recorded a series of at least 33 aftershocks, 14 of which were between magnitudes 5.0 and 5.9. The International Red Cross estimated that about three million people were affected by the quake. the Haitian Interior Minister, Paul Antoine Bien-Aimé, anticipated on January 15th that the disaster would claim between 100,000 and 200,000 lives. Haitian Prime Minister Jean-Max Bellerive announced that by 18 January over 70,000 bodies had been buried in mass graves.
living conditions were not much better than this even prior to the earthquake. help us free the one of the poorest nations on earth. 100% of the proceeds will be going to lifeline mission. They have a compound in Haiti that offers medical, food, clothing and spiritual help to aid those who have lost their friends, family members, and homes with in the last week in Haiti. please help us give back.
printed on a 50/50 blend
Shipping Info. All orders are processed immediately, but shipped out on Fridays. Transit time takes anywhere from 2-8 business days depending upon location.(up to 2 weeks for UK customers) please contact us with any concerns. Thank you all.

name: .free lives - doma human trafficking
description: 100% of the proceeds from .free lives will go to help doma fight human trafficking. America's Youth and Project Green Light's Response: domaconnection.org Recent media attention that focused on the young women who report experiencing forced prostitution in Columbus has caused public outcry. Community leaders are calling for education and empowerment for youth to protect themselves from exploitation. Green Light answers this call with a three-tiered prevention strategy: primary prevention through education, secondary prevention through empowerment and mentoring, and tertiary prevention through crisis assistance. Green Light programming derives from proven prevention models and community-based transformation focused on maximizing the assets in Columbus and surrounding communities. In the US, up to 18,000 youths are exploited for sex every year, with 300,000 more at risk. These youth are often labeled as criminals and are re-victimized through societal stigma and the juvenile justice system. With the average age of entry into prostitution at 12-14 in the United States, sex trafficking of children creates a future generation of adult prostitutes and continues this oppressive cycle. If you'd like to get involved or you want more info email our friend at Doma: amy@domaconnection.org Unisex cut. Girls order one size down. Shipping Info. All orders are processed immediately, but shipped out on Fridays. Transit time takes anywhere from 2-8 business days depending upon location.(up to 2 weeks for UK customers) please contact us with any concerns.

name: Matzu Flip (Sunshine)
description: We're proud to partner with Matzu. Flip Flops are for taking it easy, or going on adventures. These casual sandals are perfect for a day at the park or just walking around town. Made of premium natural rubber (grown from trees), you’ll feel how soft and light these sandals are compared to those made from synthetic materials. Don’t be fooled though, Matzu sandals are durable and adventurous enough to take you just about anywhere. 10% of Matzu's profits help great institutions that are working hard to advance human rights around the world. Check out www.matzu.com for more details!
